member.name: T:Mallenom.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:Mallenom.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null

member.name: T:Mallenom.ItemNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that collection or enumerable value does not contain null elements

member.name: T:Mallenom.ItemCanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that collection or enumerable value can contain null elements

member.name: T:Mallenom.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.name: M:Mallenom.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:Mallenom.ValueProviderAttribute
member.summary: For a parameter that is expected to be one of the limited set of values. Specify fields of which type should be used as values for this parameter.

member.name: T:Mallenom.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of

member.name: T:Mallenom.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:Mallenom.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:Mallenom.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not

member.name: T:Mallenom.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:Mallenom.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:Mallenom.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: T:Mallenom.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:Mallenom.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used

member.name: F:Mallenom.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member

member.name: F:Mallenom.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:Mallenom.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type

member.name: T:Mallenom.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or

member.name: F:Mallenom.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used

member.name: F:Mallenom.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used

member.name: T:Mallenom.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used

member.name: T:Mallenom.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed

member.name: T:Mallenom.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute

member.name: T:Mallenom.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcSupressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling inspections for MVC views within a class or a method

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object)

member.name: T:Mallenom.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name

member.name: T:Mallenom.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String)

member.name: T:Mallenom.CollectionAccessAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how method invocation affects content of the collection

member.name: F:Mallenom.CollectionAccessType.None
member.summary: Method does not use or modify content of the collection

member.name: F:Mallenom.CollectionAccessType.Read
member.summary: Method only reads content of the collection but does not modify it

member.name: F:Mallenom.CollectionAccessType.ModifyExistingContent
member.summary: Method can change content of the collection but does not add new elements

member.name: F:Mallenom.CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent
member.summary: Method can add new elements to the collection

member.name: T:Mallenom.AssertionMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method is assertion method, i.e. it halts control flow if one of the conditions is satisfied. To set the condition, mark one of the parameters with attribute

member.name: T:Mallenom.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: T:Mallenom.AssertionConditionType
member.summary: Specifies assertion type. If the assertion method argument satisfies the condition, then the execution continues. Otherwise, execution is assumed to be halted

member.name: F:Mallenom.AssertionConditionType.IS_TRUE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to true

member.name: F:Mallenom.AssertionConditionType.IS_FALSE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to false

member.name: F:Mallenom.AssertionConditionType.IS_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to null value

member.name: F:Mallenom.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to not null value

member.name: T:Mallenom.TerminatesProgramAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method unconditionally terminates control flow execution. For example, it could unconditionally throw exception

member.name: T:Mallenom.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:Mallenom.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.

member.name: T:Mallenom.RegexPatternAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that parameter is regular expression pattern.

member.name: T:Mallenom.XamlItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the type that has ItemsSource property and should be treated as ItemsControl-derived type, to enable inner items DataContext type resolve.

member.name: T:Mallenom.XamlItemBindingOfItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attibute. Indicates the property of some BindingBase-derived type, that is used to bind some item of ItemsControl-derived type. This annotation will enable the DataContext type resolve for XAML bindings for such properties.
member.remarks: Property should have the tree ancestor of the ItemsControl type or marked with the attribute.

member.name: T:Mallenom.NoReorder
member.summary: Prevents the Member Reordering feature from tossing members of the marked class.
member.remarks: The attribute must be mentioned in your member reordering patterns.

member.name: T:Mallenom.Assert
member.summary: A static class for verifying assumptions.

member.name: T:Mallenom.Assert.EvaluateFunction
member.summary: A function signature for Assert.Evaluate.

member.name: T:Mallenom.Assert.ImplicationFunction
member.summary: A function signature for Assert.Implies.
member.returns: Returns the truth of a predicate.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.Evaluate(Mallenom.Assert.EvaluateFunction)
member.summary: Executes the specified argument.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.AreEqual``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Verifies that two generic type data are equal. The assertion fails if they are not.
member.typeparam: The generic type to compare for equality.
member.param: The first generic type data to compare. This is is the expected value.
The second generic type data to compare. This is the actual value.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.AreNotEqual``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Verifies that two generic type data are not equal. The assertion fails if they are.
member.typeparam: The generic type to compare for inequality.
member.param: The first generic type data to compare. This is is the value that's not expected.
The second generic type data to compare. This is the actual value.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.Implies(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies that if the specified condition is true, then so is the result. The assertion fails if the condition is true but the result is false.
member.param: A second Boolean statement. If the first was true then so must this be. If the first statement was false then the value of this is ignored.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.Implies(System.Boolean,Mallenom.Assert.ImplicationFunction)
member.summary: Lazy evaluation overload. Verifies that if a condition is true, then so is a secondary value.
member.param: A function to be evaluated for truth if the condition argument is true.
member.remarks: This overload only evaluates the result if the first condition is true.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsNeitherNullNorEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that a string has content. I.e. it is not null and it is not empty.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsNeitherNullNorWhitespace(System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that a string has content. I.e. it is not null and it is not purely whitespace.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsNotNull``1(``0)
member.summary: Verifies the specified value is not null. The assertion fails if it is.
member.param: The value to check for nullness.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsFalse(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified condition is false. The assertion fails if it is true.
member.param: The expression that should be false.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsFalse(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified condition is false. The assertion fails if it is true.
member.param: The expression that should be false.
The message to display if the condition is true.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsTrue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified condition is true. The assertion fails if it is not.
member.param: A condition that is expected to be true.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsTrue(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified condition is true. The assertion fails if it is not.
member.param: A condition that is expected to be true.
The message to write in case the condition is false.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.Fail
member.summary: This line should never be executed. The assertion always fails.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.Fail(System.String)
member.summary: This line should never be executed. The assertion always fails.
member.param: The message to display if this function is executed.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsNull``1(``0)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified object is null. The assertion fails if it is not.
member.param: The item to verify is null.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.BoundedDoubleInc(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified value is within the expected range. The assertion fails if it isn't.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.BoundedInteger(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Verifies that the specified value is within the expected range. The assertion fails if it isn't.

member.name: M:Mallenom.Assert.IsApartmentState(System.Threading.ApartmentState)
member.summary: Verify the current thread's apartment state is what's expected. The assertion fails if it isn't
member.param: The expected apartment state for the current thread.
member.remarks: This breaks into the debugger in the case of a failed assertion.
